New Records: Alek Thomas became the youngest player in MLB history to hit a game-tying, pinch-hit home run in the eighth inning or later of a postseason game; Thomas is the ninth player in history to achieve this milestone
Key Match Events: Alek Thomas hit a game-tying two-run home run in the eighth inning, tying the game and revitalizing the Diamondbacks' playoff hopes; the Diamondbacks' bullpen had a momentary lapse but ultimately secured the win
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks were trailing 2-1 in the series and 5-3 in the game when Thomas came to bat; the Phillies had a strong closer, Craig Kimbrel, but he struggled, which the Diamondbacks exploited
Post-Match Reflections: Players and coaches reflected on the significance of the win, particularly Thomas's home run; the Diamondbacks' playoff journey and the impact of this win on their World Series hopes were discussed
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article mentions the challenges Thomas faced, such as his struggles against certain pitches and his limited pinch-hit opportunities before this game; the Diamondbacks' bullpen's reaction and the overall atmosphere at the game were noted
